page.title: 02COMMERCE IN LANGPORT
page.content: There are two banks; Lloyds and Nat West. Lloyds has been in the town since 1927 and Nat West was founded in 1770 as Stuckey's Bank. Both have been modernised recently and use the following up-to-date equipment;a computer terminal linked to the main computer in London,docket control voucher,franking machine and adding machine. There are 10 staff at each bank;manager,sub-manager,cashiers,plus specialists in mortgages,foreign money and stocks and shares. Three estate agents;Gribble, Booth and Taylor,Hunt's(also auctioneers) and R.B.Taylor deal with property locally.They also act as agents for Abbey National,Halifax and Britannia Building Societies.Anglia B. S. has its own branch while Bristol and West and Alliance have agencies.
